src:
Rastali se Milenko Tepić i Vareze
Srpski košarkaš je slobodan igrač

06 Nov 2019


Epizoda Milenka Tepića u Varezeu trajala je tri i po meseca. Srpski bek došao je u italijanski klub 21. jula, ali ga je danas zvanično napustio u vidu sporazumnog raskida ugovora.

Vareze se u kratkom saopštenju zahvalio Tepiću za doprinos u crveno-belom dresu i poželeo uspešan nastavak karijere. Ovakav epilog posledica je činjenice da se u tim Atilija Kaje nedavno vratio Džejson Klark posle šest sedmica pauze, kao i da je Litvanac Ignus Jakovičs potpisao produžetak saradnje. U takvim okolnositma za 32-godišnjeg Milenka nije bilo mesta u Varezeu, moraće da potraži novu sredinu.
Inače, Milenko Tepić je u ove sezone odigrao tek tri utakmice u italijanskom prvenstvu i prosečno beležio tek poen po meču. U karijeri je igrao za Vojvodinu, Partizan (dva mandata), Panatinaikos, Sevilju, Ljetuvos Ritas, PAOK (dvaput), Orlandini i Brindisi.


Pogledajte novu epizodu serije Ekipizza...





FOTO: Star sport
text:
Milenko Tepic and Varese split
Serbian basketball is a free player

06 Nov 2019


The episode of Milenko Tepic in Varese lasted three and a half months. The Serbian back came to the Italian club on 21 July, but today he officially left it in the form of an amicable termination of the contract.

In a brief statement, Varese thanked Tepic for his contribution in the red and white jersey and wished him a successful career. This epilogue is due to the fact that Jason Clark recently returned to Jason Clark after a six-week break, as well as Lithuanian Ignus Jakovičs signed an extension of cooperation. In such circumstances, there was no place for 32-year-old Milenko in Varese, he would have to look for a new environment.
By the way, Milenko Tepic has only played three games in the Italian Championship this season and averaged only one point per game. In his career he has played for Vojvodina, Partizan (two terms), Panathinaikos, Seville, Ljetuvos Ritas, PAOK (twice), Orlandini and Brindisi.


Check out the new episode of the Ekipizza series ...





PHOTO: Star Sports
